page.title: 08Making Cheshire Cheese
page.content: Fifty years ago we started work at 6am when the cows were handmilked by the dim light of paraffin lamps.The milk was kept warm with water heated in a coal-fired boiler.The curds and whey were stirred by hand using a wooden rake.The curd was ready for hand milling by 1pm and all the family helped the farmers wife with this. The cheese was then put into moulds and carried to the cheese oven by the kitchen fire grate.The utensils were then scrubbed and scalded by 2pm. At 3.30pm afternoon milking started and the milk was poured into the vat ready for the next day's cheese. Before going to bed the farmer's wife tightened the cheese presses and checked that the cheese starter had thickened ready for the next day. One gallon of milk made 1 pound of cheese.
